page.title: 19Bernwode Meadows-Oakley
page.content: One morning last week some of us went to Bernwode Meadows to study wild flowers.We saw some rare species and many common ones induding red and white clover,ladies slipper and speedwell.The spotted orchid had light,thin leaves with purple-green blotches on.Much of the adjoining forest is conifer.We saw many deer tracks and plenty of squirrels there.We went into the watch tower from where we saw several common birds.We had hoped to see a Purple Emperor butterfly as there are some in the forest,but were unluky on this occasion.We also saw on the main track, a strange stile.It had one main gate like the entrance to any field and small fence at the side which you press down to climb over.
